docs.snippet: A TELEGRAM signed "God" is taped to the wall of a Howard Johnson motel room in this seedy city of Miss America, and it congratulates the recipient, Ellen Burstyn, on her sensational performance in "The Last Picture Show." "God" concludes his messa...
docs.lead_paragraph: A TELEGRAM signed "God" is taped to the wall of a Howard Johnson motel room in this seedy city of Miss America, and it congratulates the recipient, Ellen Burstyn, on her sensational performance in "The Last Picture Show." "God" concludes his message by elevating the 39-year-old angel-faced actress to sainthood.
docs.abstract: Actress E Burstyn, who appeared in film The Last Picture Show and will appear in film Philosopher King, int on both films and career; Burstyn illus

headline.main: What's Her Next Picture Show About? Ellen's Not Telling; Ellen Burstyn

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON -- There is now a good chance that at least one serious candidate for the presidency this year, Hubert Humphrey, will endorse in principle the strongly anti - import, anti-international-investment bill in Congress backed by organized la...
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON -- There is now a good chance that at least one serious candidate for the presidency this year, Hubert Humphrey, will endorse in principle the strongly anti - import, anti-international-investment bill in Congress backed by organized labor.
docs.abstract: article on prospects for passage of US Foreign Trade and Investment Act of '72 during Pres election yr in US notes Pres aspirant Sen Humphrey will endorse bill in principle and that leading Dem candidate Sen Muskie could take similar position; holds bill is result of pressure of organized labor, backed by parts of indus, for major change in US basic foreign econ policy; says bill essentially declares multinatl cos adverse to US interests and would hamper internatl cos in any number of ways, from taxation to licensing; says attack of US corp investment abroad by AFL-CIO on ground that it costs jobs at home can be and is being refuted, although figures inevitably remain somewhat fuzzy

headline.main: ' Situation Report' on an Import Bill

docs.snippet: BOGOTA, Colombia, Jan. 22 (AP) -- Bands of roving guerrillas have begun the new year with a series of terrorist attacks and political harangues to captive audiences....
docs.lead_paragraph: BOGOTA, Colombia, Jan. 22 (AP) -- Bands of roving guerrillas have begun the new year with a series of terrorist attacks and political harangues to captive audiences.
docs.abstract: Roving guerrilla bands begin series of terrorist attacks and pol harangues in Colombia; consist of 3 main groups: Natl Liberation Army, with about 250 men, Revolutionary Armies of Colombia, with 150, and Maoist Popular Army of Liberation, with about 80 members; Natl Liberation Army, probably most active group, is led by 2 brothers, F and M Vasquez Castano; recently tore through small town of San Pablo, rounding up 10,000 inhabitants and forcing them to listen to their ss in which they vowed to take over country; split into smaller groups to carry out simultaneous attacks on several northeastern towns

headline.main: GUERRILLA BANDS HARASS COLOMBIA; Three Main Groups Combine Terrorism and Politics
The Man Who Signed That Midget

docs.snippet: Daytime television is a woman's world of exquisitely prolonged suffering, greed, hate, abortions, betrayals and young and middle-aged love. It is a world with a seemingly endless fascination for some 50 million viewers who together make up a marke...
docs.lead_paragraph: Daytime television is a woman's world of exquisitely prolonged suffering, greed, hate, abortions, betrayals and young and middle-aged love. It is a world with a seemingly endless fascination for some 50 million viewers who together make up a market of more than $300-million annually for which the three major networks battle tirelessly.
docs.abstract: Article discusses efforts of major TV networks to improve their daytime ratings; notes that networks are vying for approximately 50-million viewers who make up mkt of over $300-million; CBS, slipping from long daytime lead, has hired away its foremost antagonist, NBC daytime programing dir B D Grant; network execs M Eisner (ABC), O Katz (CBS) and B D Grant (CBS) comment; pors

headline.main: C.B.S. Slipping From Long Daytime TV Lead

docs.snippet: ALBANY, Jan. 19 -- The State University Construction Fund today announced the suspension of 150 projects valued at $215-million involving classroom space and dormitories....
docs.lead_paragraph: ALBANY, Jan. 19 -- The State University Construction Fund today announced the suspension of 150 projects valued at $215-million involving classroom space and dormitories.
docs.abstract: SUNY Construction Fund announces suspension of 150 projects valued at $215-million involving classroom space and dormitories; also announces suspension of 82 additional projects that would have cost $125-million, resulting in $27-million savings in architectural fees; additional $25-million is also projected in savings by cost reductions on 18 other projects; cuts are response to Gov Rockefeller's recent proposal that $162-million of construction appropriations be repealed as well as additional $77-million in dormitory construction; Rockefeller, in projected budget, proposed $470.7-million in operating funds for univ, $5.1-million decrease from last yr; this will mean that univ will accept only 4,599 students this yr instead of anticipated 15,000; some centers affected by cutbacks noted

headline.main: State U. Suspends 150 Projects Valued at Total of $215-Million

byline.original: By ALFONSO A. NARVAEZSpecial to The New York Times

docs.snippet: The New York Yankees acquired John Callison from the Chicago Cubs yesterday and said they would try the 32-year-old left-handed hitter as a pinch-hitter and reserve outfielder....

headline.main: Yankees Get Callison From Cubs for a Look

docs.snippet: For some weeks, Senator Jacob K. Javits had been ballyhooing his intention of making the Navy unhappy by nominating the first female midshipman for the Naval Academy at Annapolis. Only this week Mr. Javits announced he would make his nominee's nam...
docs.lead_paragraph: For some weeks, Senator Jacob K. Javits had been ballyhooing his intention of making the Navy unhappy by nominating the first female midshipman for the Naval Academy at Annapolis. Only this week Mr. Javits announced he would make his nominee's name known next Tuesday, and her identity was shrouded in secrecy.
docs.abstract: L E and K Pasternak, children of late Russian novelist B Pasternak, cable Appeals Ct in Milan asking to be heard as witnesses in trial regarding disputed royalties on Pasternak's book Dr Zhivago; plaintiff is S Dangelo, who says he acted as go-between for G Feltrinelli, Milan publisher who brought book to West; Feltrinelli has rejected as forgery document Dangelo says was signed by Pasternak directing that one-half of author's royalties be given to Dangelo; case is adjourned to give Pasternak's heirs time to travel to Milan to testify

docs.snippet: INGLEWOOD, Calif., Jan. 18 -- Jerry West's 21-foot jump shot with one second to play provided a spectacular finish and gave the West a 112-110 victory over the East tonight in the 22d annual National Basketball Association All-Star game....
docs.lead_paragraph: INGLEWOOD, Calif., Jan. 18 -- Jerry West's 21-foot jump shot with one second to play provided a spectacular finish and gave the West a 112-110 victory over the East tonight in the 22d annual National Basketball Association All-Star game.
docs.abstract: West defeats East, 112-110, in NBA All-Star game; illus

headline.main: Jerry West's Shot With Second to Go Downs East in All-Star Game, 112-110; 21 - Footer Produces Dramatic Triumph for N.B.A. West JERRY WEST SHOT TOPS EAST, 112-110
